content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> Noam Rosenthal: anyway, thanks, that helps! Adding a note somewhere to explain the purpose of the purpose header would be nice I think, once we decide how to specify it.

I will add a note. Regarding opt-out, one can send `Cache-Control: no-store` when they get that header.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
Noam Rosenthal: anyway, thanks, that helps! Adding a note somewhere to explain the purpose of the purpose header would be nice I think, once we decide how to specify it.
I will add a note. Regarding opt-out, one can send Cache-Control: no-store when they get that header.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> Noam Rosenthal: anyway, thanks, that helps! Adding a note somewhere to explain the purpose of the purpose header would be nice I think, once we decide how to specify it.

I will add a note. Regarding opt-out, one can send `Cache-Control: no-store` when they get that header.

In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
Noam Rosenthal: anyway, thanks, that helps! Adding a note somewhere to explain the purpose of the purpose header would be nice I think, once we decide how to specify it.
I will add a note. Regarding opt-out, one can send Cache-Control: no-store when they get that header.

content.body: annevk: prefetch doesn't touch the memory cache
content.formatted_body: annevk: prefetch doesn't touch the memory cache

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: annevk: prefetch doesn't touch the memory cache
annevk: prefetch doesn't touch the memory cache

content.body: it's just a nudge to the HTTP cache
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it's just a nudge to the HTTP cache

content.body: so if you set a no-store, the next fetch would get it from the network again
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: so if you set a no-store, the next fetch would get it from the network again

content.body: it's totally how it works today
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it's totally how it works today

content.body: ... memory caches are resource-type-specific and prefetch has no resource-type
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: ... memory caches are resource-type-specific and prefetch has no resource-type

content.body: if the service wants to opt-out of HTTP caching and the service worker overrides it, the service-worker gets precedence
